commit_message:
More services to deployments

This patch set changes nova-api and neutron-server to use Deployments
similar to the rest. This allows them to seamlessly scale and minor
upgrades to be applied without downtime.

It also makes some minor tweaks to the other Deployments to make them
 more similar to each other in preparation for a future PS to merge
them into a single template. They now look very similar.

Lastly, nova-novncproxy was in dos format. This changes it to be in
unix format like the rest.

Change-Id: I8ac7e938842b9aa48d536b4024368fdf82f7ff62
Partially-Implements: blueprint api-termination
Partially-Implements: blueprint deployments

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 09:25:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/placement/requestlog.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/placement/test_requestlog.py'], 'message': "[placement] clean up some nits in the requestlog middleware

In the review of I4215cc69cedae5637102b75e0b54fd26acb1826c there
were some suggested improvements that did not get implemented
because we needed the better logging sooner than later.

This change implements those cleanups including:

* use ',' instead of '%' for string interpolation in calls to LOG
* add microversion information to log string, if present

Closes-Bug: #1619690

commit_message:
[placement] clean up some nits in the requestlog middleware

In the review of I4215cc69cedae5637102b75e0b54fd26acb1826c there
were some suggested improvements that did not get implemented
because we needed the better logging sooner than later.

This change implements those cleanups including:

* use ',' instead of '%' for string interpolation in calls to LOG
* add microversion information to log string, if present

Change-Id: I6682215d72b644217b5122073d993a99f7830e5b
Closes-Bug: #1619690

Newly registered nodes begin in the enroll provision state by default
instead of available.

Actions added to the current dropdown on node view to enable move to
manageable, available and active states. Actions are enabled and

Co-Authored-By: Peter Piela <ppiela@cray.com>

commit_message:
Updated to ironic API v1.11 and added manageable state

Newly registered nodes begin in the enroll provision state by default
instead of available.

Actions added to the current dropdown on node view to enable move to
manageable, available and active states. Actions are enabled and
disabled in view as the current state permits.

All necessary fields required to move a node to available state are
still required on the enroll node modal. This will be changed to only
the necessary fields to move a node to enroll state once the
functionality for editing a node is ready.

Change-Id: I349a293a1069ad01fd782d1828bad607f9b9d6b0
Co-Authored-By: Peter Piela <ppiela@cray.com>

commit_message:
Skip unstable v6 scenario tests

In the interest of stabilizing the gate closer to the end of Newton, this
test should be skipped as it fails sporadically showing that IPv6 is not
robust enough. No-one is taking serious ownership of the required fix,
and thus the onus is on IPv6 owners to re-enable this test should they
care about the feature being rock solid, and continuously tested.

Related-bug: #1540983

Change-Id: Ibd30f8d90b1ce76a219e02935cec52b402b15168

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-05 20:56:30.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump 'global-requirements' for 'oslo.concurrency' to 2.6.1

In this[1] change, when it was initially proposed to update
'global-requirements', but we ended up only updating the
'upper-constraints.txt', because of concerns that bumping
'oslo.concurrency' also bumped related components: 'pbr', 'oslo.config'
and 'oslo.utils'.

Another argument went:

    "We do not generally raise the minimum version of dependencies to
    fix bugs, and we especially don't want to do that in stable
    branches. Please update this to only changes the
    upper-constraints.txt file."

However, these above arguments are questioned in this Nova backport[2],
where we try to handle the case of deployments not having new
enough oslo.concurrency.

All of this to get a fix for CVE-2015-5162 -- "qemu-img calls need to be
restricted by ulimit"

[1] [stable/liberty requiements]
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333403/ -- Bump 'upper-constraints'
    for 'oslo.concurrency' to 2.6.1

[2] [stable/liberty openstack-nova]
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/327624/ -- virt: set address space
    & CPU time limits when running qemu-img

Change-Id: Ic9f75f2147c53da72e3aa0b2369c5f8de4d8d435
'}]
commit_message:
Bump 'global-requirements' for 'oslo.concurrency' to 2.6.1

In this[1] change, when it was initially proposed to update
'global-requirements', but we ended up only updating the
'upper-constraints.txt', because of concerns that bumping
'oslo.concurrency' also bumped related components: 'pbr', 'oslo.config'
and 'oslo.utils'.

Another argument went:

    "We do not generally raise the minimum version of dependencies to
    fix bugs, and we especially don't want to do that in stable
    branches. Please update this to only changes the
    upper-constraints.txt file."

However, these above arguments are questioned in this Nova backport[2],
where we try to handle the case of deployments not having new
enough oslo.concurrency.

All of this to get a fix for CVE-2015-5162 -- "qemu-img calls need to be
restricted by ulimit"

[1] [stable/liberty requiements]
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333403/ -- Bump 'upper-constraints'
    for 'oslo.concurrency' to 2.6.1

[2] [stable/liberty openstack-nova]
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/327624/ -- virt: set address space
    & CPU time limits when running qemu-img

Change-Id: Ic9f75f2147c53da72e3aa0b2369c5f8de4d8d435

subject: Do not attempt deletion of a DELETE_COMPLETE stack in service api
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 12259, 'name': 'Anant Patil', 'email': 'anant.techie@gmail.com', 'username': 'ananta'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-22 04:53:22.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Do not attempt deletion of a DELETE_COMPLETE stack in service api

A stack may be in transient state where it is DELETE_COMPLETE, but has
has not actually been soft-deleted yet. For the purposes of
delete_stack in service.py, consider a DELETE_COMPLETE stack as
equivalent to a soft-deleted one (it soon will be), thereby avoiding a
race where we would have attempted to update the stack, running into a
foreign-key constraint issue for a non-existing user_cred.

Change-Id: Iec021e6a0df262d447fdf9ee1789603c7a1c55f8
Closes-Bug: #1626173
Closes-Bug: #1626107
'}]
commit_message:
Do not attempt deletion of a DELETE_COMPLETE stack in service api

A stack may be in transient state where it is DELETE_COMPLETE, but has
has not actually been soft-deleted yet. For the purposes of
delete_stack in service.py, consider a DELETE_COMPLETE stack as
equivalent to a soft-deleted one (it soon will be), thereby avoiding a
race where we would have attempted to update the stack, running into a
foreign-key constraint issue for a non-existing user_cred.

Change-Id: Iec021e6a0df262d447fdf9ee1789603c7a1c55f8
Closes-Bug: #1626173
Closes-Bug: #1626107

subject: Use the proper private keys for ssh config file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-21 23:26:15.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/ssh_config.j2', 'roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/ssh_config_no_undercloud.j2'], 'message': 'Use the proper private keys for ssh config file

When regenerating the ssh config through the tripleo-inventory role the
private keys were statically defined instead of taken from the
inventory. This can cause errors, as we might have different keys in use
during execution.

For example using the id_rsa_virt_power key was incorrect, as the
provision/remote role adds and defines the correct virthost key as

virt_host_key: "{{ local_working_dir }}/id_rsa_virt_host"

It was still working, but there was a discrepancy between the inventory
and the ssh config.

Change-Id: Ied20e2306fbc1fb94a4654d0eed9d5058bc579ae
'}]
commit_message:
Use the proper private keys for ssh config file

When regenerating the ssh config through the tripleo-inventory role the
private keys were statically defined instead of taken from the
inventory. This can cause errors, as we might have different keys in use
during execution.

For example using the id_rsa_virt_power key was incorrect, as the
provision/remote role adds and defines the correct virthost key as

virt_host_key: "{{ local_working_dir }}/id_rsa_virt_host"

It was still working, but there was a discrepancy between the inventory
and the ssh config.

Change-Id: Ied20e2306fbc1fb94a4654d0eed9d5058bc579ae

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 18:59:32.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/drac/vendor_passthru.py'], 'message': 'Fix DRAC passthru 'list_unfinished_jobs' desc

This fixes the description for DRAC's "list_unfinished_jobs()"
passthru method. It incorrectly indicates that there are
required arguments, but no arguments are required from the caller
of that REST API. The description indicates what is returned
by that method.

This is a followup to I963504dbbec36e44312ccbf4455c45d6ec60908b.

Change-Id: I4070f30b9898ef9f17c585ddba68cdac4d6335c7
Related-Bug: #1621515
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DRAC passthru 'list_unfinished_jobs' desc

This fixes the description for DRAC's "list_unfinished_jobs()"
passthru method. It incorrectly indicates that there are
required arguments, but no arguments are required from the caller
of that REST API. The description indicates what is returned
by that method.

This is a followup to I963504dbbec36e44312ccbf4455c45d6ec60908b.

Change-Id: I4070f30b9898ef9f17c585ddba68cdac4d6335c7
Related-Bug: #1621515

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-22 08:12:28.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/plugins/ml2/drivers/calico/t_etcd.py'], 'message': 'Fix multiple interface prefixes support

With this patch networking-calico does not overwrite InterfacePrefix
in etcd with `tap` value. Instead it appends `tap` prefix
to InterfacePrefix value if it exists, otherwise it writes
`tap` value.

Depends-On: https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/pull/1104

Change-Id: I8656e9cb96812ceda70313eb056c6b1380d5e717
Closes-Bug: #1626020
'}]
commit_message:
Fix multiple interface prefixes support

With this patch networking-calico does not overwrite InterfacePrefix
in etcd with `tap` value. Instead it appends `tap` prefix
to InterfacePrefix value if it exists, otherwise it writes
`tap` value.

Depends-On: https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/pull/1104

Change-Id: I8656e9cb96812ceda70313eb056c6b1380d5e717
Closes-Bug: #1626020

commit_message:
Adding a script for fast mistralclient help generation

 * This script allows generating helpstrings
   of all mistralclient commands and adopt them
   to rst format.
 * This script is just POC and requires a further
   manual editing in order to make the document
   more clear.

Change-Id: If5f9144a254ef0b97c17e66638641e1052cc08d1

subject: Force Ansible to use dynamic includes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-22 11:38:28.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/designate_init_common.yml', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tasks/designate_install.yml'], 'message': 'Force Ansible to use dynamic includes

Ansible 2.1.1 introduces a regression in the way conditional
includes are handled which results in every task in the
included file being evaluated even if the condition for the
include is not met. This extends the run time significantly
for a deployment.

This patch forces all conditional includes to be dynamic.

Change-Id: Iea4689aa17b232911275d9a51cfbd5713b78a557
Related-Bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/17687
'}]
commit_message:
Force Ansible to use dynamic includes

Ansible 2.1.1 introduces a regression in the way conditional
includes are handled which results in every task in the
included file being evaluated even if the condition for the
include is not met. This extends the run time significantly
for a deployment.

This patch forces all conditional includes to be dynamic.

Change-Id: Iea4689aa17b232911275d9a51cfbd5713b78a557
Related-Bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/17687

subject: Workaround for resources stuck in progress after engine crash
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-09 14:46:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/api.py', 'heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Workaround for resources stuck in progress after engine crash

Added a "force_all" boolean to the reset_stack_status() method.
If force_all is True, the stack is reset regardless of whether or not
the stack is in an IN_PROGRESS state. This allows a stack to be reset
in the scenario that the engine dies in the middle of a stack action
and leaves resources stuck in an IN_PROGRESS state. Added the optional
parameters "-f" and "--force" to the command to allow this force reset.

Change-Id: I9771220f1560b4a3267f240b834baa6c13d007e3
Related-Bug: #1570576
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for resources stuck in progress after engine crash

Added a "force_all" boolean to the reset_stack_status() method.
If force_all is True, the stack is reset regardless of whether or not
the stack is in an IN_PROGRESS state. This allows a stack to be reset
in the scenario that the engine dies in the middle of a stack action
and leaves resources stuck in an IN_PROGRESS state. Added the optional
parameters "-f" and "--force" to the command to allow this force reset.

Change-Id: I9771220f1560b4a3267f240b834baa6c13d007e3
Related-Bug: #1570576

Force Ansible to use dynamic includes

Ansible 2.1.1 introduces a regression in the way conditional
includes are handled which results in every task in the
included file being evaluated even if the condition for the
include is not met. This extends the run time significantly
for a deployment.

This patch forces all conditional includes to be dynamic.

commit_message:
Fetching effective resource values optimized

Now only required resource values are fetched on calculating
effective values.
Calculation of effective values optimised to use indexed resource
values insead of going throw nested for loop.
Test for fetching values and effective values for 500 items
(nodes) added. Each resource value contains over than 10000 keys.
Logging added to the resource values fetching.

Change-Id: Icea7ece8a2bc6957bcb00c9d90d8cf59e5ca1da0
Closes-Bug: #1626147

commit_message:
Introduce uniqueness constraint on resource names

Resource names are handled to be unique per tenant for all 3
resources vnfd, vnf and vim.

Also existing duplicate names are updated to name-<12char. uudid>
based on resource id's last 12 char. to handle the uniqueness
constraint on 'name' column for all 3 resources.

Change-Id: I689d7219db67892b855e1dc5c3698f9e1a67b408
Closes-Bug: #1475047
Closes-Bug: #1474993

commit_message:
Build vfc mappings for migration with vios slot collocation

The migration data on the source sets information about the slots
which are collocated on a VIOS.

This is used along with the fabric port information on the destination
host to make sure the client slots are maintained on the same VIOS.

Change-Id: Iddb4a535b67a7a157a2ac4be97a3ce028fed1696
Closes-Bug: #1623889
(cherry picked from commit 1e9eed79bf72e6b7d38bce86f4d807d08cff75be)

subject: Revert "Setup defaults for swift driver authentication"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-20 15:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/utils.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Setup defaults for swift driver authentication"

Change I90665dabaab13a9c9d5f00770496f8ccfccba024 introduces default
values for *_domain_id.

The code in [1] uses user_domain_id if it is set, user_domain_name is
only even looked at if user_domain_id == None.

So setting a default value for user_domain_id is bound to break things.
Maybe an alternative solution for ansible might be to instead default to
user_domain_name='default', assuming their default domain is called that
way.

See comments on bug to understand the full ramifications.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/identity/v3/password.py#L43

Closes-Bug: 1620999

Co-Authored-By: Jens Rosenboom <j.rosenboom@x-ion.de>
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Komawar <nik.komawar@gmail.com>

This reverts commit 1ae475c88efc5c06e00210894cda9c9db15b6d4a.

Change-Id: I696813edfc823d4ac9422e82f5473ff0ee8a5616
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Setup defaults for swift driver authentication"

Change I90665dabaab13a9c9d5f00770496f8ccfccba024 introduces default
values for *_domain_id.

The code in [1] uses user_domain_id if it is set, user_domain_name is
only even looked at if user_domain_id == None.

So setting a default value for user_domain_id is bound to break things.
Maybe an alternative solution for ansible might be to instead default to
user_domain_name='default', assuming their default domain is called that
way.

See comments on bug to understand the full ramifications.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/identity/v3/password.py#L43

Closes-Bug: 1620999

Co-Authored-By: Jens Rosenboom <j.rosenboom@x-ion.de>
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Komawar <nik.komawar@gmail.com>

This reverts commit 1ae475c88efc5c06e00210894cda9c9db15b6d4a.

Change-Id: I696813edfc823d4ac9422e82f5473ff0ee8a5616

commit_message:
Clean up release notes for 6.2.0

This is cleaned up as of commit
2351d624aed7aae9d58ce37676c0181687be0e8a, and should be sufficient for
the final release. If something else with a release note lands, we can
make any changes there in a later patch.

Change-Id: Ia1ef442f3cc0d64c8a7c6fbb5aaf3f0160f214de

commit_message:
Fix Boot From Volume size error

Added logic to check whether the booted instance is boot from
volume, as well as if it is a snapshot that was booted from volume.
If so set the min_disk differently.

Change-Id: I577c6f02e6a402ba4f8427bef382faa7e1e1af9c
Closes-Bug: #1587108

commit_message:
Rename function to run cmd with sourced openrc

This function performs source of the openrc file to use appropriate
environment variables suitable for the cloud. In most cases it is useful
for any openstack command.

The function was also renamed to run_with_openrc.

Change-Id: I488b8e244fe9b76875d3be9d263729168a2a05ab

commit_message:
DRAC: list unfinished jobs

After set_bios_config is invoked, there is no way to check the progress
of the remote job on the DRAC card. list_unfinished_jobs on the
vendor-passthru interface provides a way to check its status.

Change-Id: I963504dbbec36e44312ccbf4455c45d6ec60908b
Closes-Bug: #1621515

subject: Fix column name for output of `rally task detailed --iterations-data`
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-22 10:40:19.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cli/commands/task.py'], 'message': "Fix column name for output of `rally task detailed --iterations-data`

The `rally task detailed --iterations-data` command prints an output
like this:

+---------------------------+
|   Atomics per iteration   |
+-----------+---------------+
| iteration | full duration |
+-----------+---------------+
| 1         | 0.598         |
| 2         | 0.838         |
| 3         | 0.906         |
| 4         | 0.763         |
| 5         | 0.929         |
| 6         | 0.632         |
| 7         | 0.636         |
| 8         | 0.926         |
| 9         | 0.702         |
| 10        | 0.756         |
+-----------+---------------+

However, the term 'full duration' is not applicable to a single iteration.
It should be applicable to all iterations. So the output should be as follows:

+---------------------------+
|   Atomics per iteration   |
+-----------+---------------+
| iteration | duration      |
+-----------+---------------+
| 1         | 0.598         |
| 2         | 0.838         |
| 3         | 0.906         |
| 4         | 0.763         |
| 5         | 0.929         |
| 6         | 0.632         |
| 7         | 0.636         |
| 8         | 0.926         |
| 9         | 0.702         |
| 10        | 0.756         |
+-----------+---------------+

Change-Id: I5714b486b10a21758d47993413c566a561f78197
"}]
commit_message:
Fix column name for output of `rally task detailed --iterations-data`

The `rally task detailed --iterations-data` command prints an output
like this:

+---------------------------+
|   Atomics per iteration   |
+-----------+---------------+
| iteration | full duration |
+-----------+---------------+
| 1         | 0.598         |
| 2         | 0.838         |
| 3         | 0.906         |
| 4         | 0.763         |
| 5         | 0.929         |
| 6         | 0.632         |
| 7         | 0.636         |
| 8         | 0.926         |
| 9         | 0.702         |
| 10        | 0.756         |
+-----------+---------------+

However, the term 'full duration' is not applicable to a single iteration.
It should be applicable to all iterations. So the output should be as follows:

+---------------------------+
|   Atomics per iteration   |
+-----------+---------------+
| iteration | duration      |
+-----------+---------------+
| 1         | 0.598         |
| 2         | 0.838         |
| 3         | 0.906         |
| 4         | 0.763         |
| 5         | 0.929         |
| 6         | 0.632         |
| 7         | 0.636         |
| 8         | 0.926         |
| 9         | 0.702         |
| 10        | 0.756         |
+-----------+---------------+

Change-Id: I5714b486b10a21758d47993413c566a561f78197

subject: Update the order of release note page
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-22 09:38:39.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'Update the order of release note page

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I8eca97a75f8c6ee1f41712678b12b7e9dac655dd
'}]
commit_message:
Update the order of release note page

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I8eca97a75f8c6ee1f41712678b12b7e9dac655dd

subject: Add req_cleanup block for Fedora templates
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-15 15:05:15.000000000', 'files': ['renderspec/dist-templates/fedora.spec.j2'], 'message': 'Add req_cleanup block for Fedora templates

Fedora specs use to remove requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt
during %prep, to prevent any attempt to download from PyPi while
building.

Adding a block to allow this in the template specs. To use it, just
add the following at the end of the %prep section:

{% block req_cleanup %}{% endblock %}

Change-Id: I5b516ede7b3333660d0ec1afac8025bf3c70c14b
'}]
commit_message:
Add req_cleanup block for Fedora templates

Fedora specs use to remove requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt
during %prep, to prevent any attempt to download from PyPi while
building.

Adding a block to allow this in the template specs. To use it, just
add the following at the end of the %prep section:

{% block req_cleanup %}{% endblock %}

Change-Id: I5b516ede7b3333660d0ec1afac8025bf3c70c14b

commit_message:
Remove 'when' when including bootstrap/register tasks

Using when together with run_once and delegate_to inside an included
task file can result in skipped tasks.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 19:21:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/userguide.rst', 'magnum/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh', 'magnum/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh', 'doc/source/dev/quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Update name of ubuntu-mesos image

Update the gate and docs to use "ubuntu-mesos-latest" instead of
"ubuntu-14.04.3-mesos-0.25.0.qcow2". The intent is to make the
image upgrade easier (by using a static image name). In fedorapeople,
a soft link was created from "ubuntu-mesos-latest.qcow2" to

Change-Id: I544773d184e5436843595dbfd9ab118b99870281

commit_message:
Update name of ubuntu-mesos image

Update the gate and docs to use "ubuntu-mesos-latest" instead of
"ubuntu-14.04.3-mesos-0.25.0.qcow2". The intent is to make the
image upgrade easier (by using a static image name). In fedorapeople,
a soft link was created from "ubuntu-mesos-latest.qcow2" to
"ubuntu-14.04.3-mesos-0.25.0.qcow2"

Change-Id: I544773d184e5436843595dbfd9ab118b99870281

commit_message:
Increase unit test coverage.

This commit is one of several that are for increasing unit test coverage.
These commits will be submitted in blocks of 500-600 lines to make them more manageable.
This commit focuses on the v1 components of the API and common utils.

subject: Update port provisioning block registration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 19:01:53.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': "Update port provisioning block registration

Deployments with the neutron DHCP agent must ensure that port status
is not changed to ACTIVE until OVN finishes provisioning the port.
This is done by adding provisioning blocks when a port is created
and when OVN marks the port down. The later provisioning block is
currently missing. Without the block, the neutron DHCP agent may
change the port status to ACTIVE before OVN is ready. In addition,
the provisioning block added during port creation should be done
during the ML2 precommit stage to avoid a similar problem.

Missing provisioning blocks creates a couple problems. The first
and easiest to notice problem is that shutting down an instance
keeps the port status ACTIVE when it should be DOWN. The second
and much more difficult problem is a timing window which is
generated during instance actions. The timing window can prevent
neutron from generating a network-vif-plugged event when nova
expects one. The event isn't generated because networking-ovn
didn't add a provisioning block to prevent the neutron DHCP
agent from interferring with VIF plugging.

Change-Id: I8355c94dbafaf7bc3f12871b7127db0087b67761
Closes-Bug: 1624120
(cherry picked from commit 4ae6b676236e568ba31dcc602c6f6b3165b60481)
"}]
commit_message:
Update port provisioning block registration

Deployments with the neutron DHCP agent must ensure that port status
is not changed to ACTIVE until OVN finishes provisioning the port.
This is done by adding provisioning blocks when a port is created
and when OVN marks the port down. The later provisioning block is
currently missing. Without the block, the neutron DHCP agent may
change the port status to ACTIVE before OVN is ready. In addition,
the provisioning block added during port creation should be done
during the ML2 precommit stage to avoid a similar problem.

Missing provisioning blocks creates a couple problems. The first
and easiest to notice problem is that shutting down an instance
keeps the port status ACTIVE when it should be DOWN. The second
and much more difficult problem is a timing window which is
generated during instance actions. The timing window can prevent
neutron from generating a network-vif-plugged event when nova
expects one. The event isn't generated because networking-ovn
didn't add a provisioning block to prevent the neutron DHCP
agent from interferring with VIF plugging.

Change-Id: I8355c94dbafaf7bc3f12871b7127db0087b67761
Closes-Bug: 1624120
(cherry picked from commit 4ae6b676236e568ba31dcc602c6f6b3165b60481)

subject: Switch default image location back to CentOS CDN
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-22 12:17:16.000000000', 'files': ['config/release/liberty.yml', 'config/release/master.yml', 'config/release/mitaka.yml', 'config/release/newton.yml'], 'message': 'Switch default image location back to CentOS CDN

Since changing the way we do the image promotion to make it an
atomic operation, we are no longer seeing the md5sum mismatch
issue. As such, we should return to using the CDN for the default
image location as this is much faster than our file server on OS1.

Change-Id: I1d7e6f2f16c727ab16999a8ac5f0a4a3201c7de8
'}]
commit_message:
Switch default image location back to CentOS CDN

Since changing the way we do the image promotion to make it an
atomic operation, we are no longer seeing the md5sum mismatch
issue. As such, we should return to using the CDN for the default
image location as this is much faster than our file server on OS1.

Change-Id: I1d7e6f2f16c727ab16999a8ac5f0a4a3201c7de8

commit_message:
Upgrade openstacksdk to 0.9.7

The 0.9.6 versions of openstacksdk released this week contain a serious
bug that has been fixed in 0.9.7. The bug was making python-senlinclient
unusable and breaking senlin gate jobs.

Change-Id: Ife22d5f0a2c0f68d971b9f63b5dc84077272a456

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-22 12:50:41.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker-init.yaml'], 'message': "Noop all the TripleO::Services during the major-upgrade-pacemaker-init step

During the first step of the upgrade process, we set the repos that
point to the new version. Once we launch this step, the undercloud
has newton templates but the overcloud still has the previous' release
puppet-tripleo packages installed. We need to noop all the composable
services because they need a newer puppet-tripleo in order to work.

With this change I managed to achieve a working M->N
major-upgrade-pacemaker-init step and the overcloud was still
up and running.

Change-Id: I3cd2c179e4c362aae6dad1433bca6d268f8e0a56
Closes-Bug: #1626452
"}]
commit_message:
Noop all the TripleO::Services during the major-upgrade-pacemaker-init step

During the first step of the upgrade process, we set the repos that
point to the new version. Once we launch this step, the undercloud
has newton templates but the overcloud still has the previous' release
puppet-tripleo packages installed. We need to noop all the composable
services because they need a newer puppet-tripleo in order to work.

With this change I managed to achieve a working M->N
major-upgrade-pacemaker-init step and the overcloud was still
up and running.

Change-Id: I3cd2c179e4c362aae6dad1433bca6d268f8e0a56
Closes-Bug: #1626452

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-16 16:25:29.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Revert "Create overcloud images for liberty using EXT4"

The max filename length in ext4 seems to be shorter than the
default allowed by Rados. In Ceph/Jewel there is a check [1]
which prevents the OSD service from starting, in Ceph/Hammer
this check wasn't enforced but would still be problematic so
we should prefer xfs, as per [2].

1. http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/16187
2. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/hammer/rados/configuration/filesystem-recommendations/

This reverts commit 861c5bd33b91068cecf1fc96aed70c829f172b0a.

Change-Id: Ib696752d19873952644229b1eddcb0a9cffff0dc
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Create overcloud images for liberty using EXT4"

The max filename length in ext4 seems to be shorter than the
default allowed by Rados. In Ceph/Jewel there is a check [1]
which prevents the OSD service from starting, in Ceph/Hammer
this check wasn't enforced but would still be problematic so
we should prefer xfs, as per [2].

1. http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/16187
2. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/hammer/rados/configuration/filesystem-recommendations/

This reverts commit 861c5bd33b91068cecf1fc96aed70c829f172b0a.

Change-Id: Ib696752d19873952644229b1eddcb0a9cffff0dc

subject: Fix __str__ not returning a String for KeystoneException
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-12 19:33:26.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/exc.py'], 'message': 'Fix __str__ not returning a String for KeystoneException

KeystoneExcepion is only created with the Exception returned by
Keystone. However, since it was derived from BaseException, __init__
expected a message not an Exception. This caused:

TypeError: __str__ returned non-string (type AuthorizationFailure)

if you tried to print out the resulting KeystoneException.

Fixed this by deriving from Exception which knows how to handle an
Exception passed in

Change-Id: I6450b59f5ccd32d34ea3e531098eeebfcb36196e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix __str__ not returning a String for KeystoneException

KeystoneExcepion is only created with the Exception returned by
Keystone. However, since it was derived from BaseException, __init__
expected a message not an Exception. This caused:

TypeError: __str__ returned non-string (type AuthorizationFailure)

if you tried to print out the resulting KeystoneException.

Fixed this by deriving from Exception which knows how to handle an
Exception passed in

Change-Id: I6450b59f5ccd32d34ea3e531098eeebfcb36196e

commit_message:
Add filtering options to os network list command

This patch adds the following filtering options: '--name', '--internal',
'--share' and '--no-share', '--enable' and '--disable', '--project'
and '--project-domain', '--status'.

Change-Id: I7e9dd372ee572c6ee8cdba7fac3182f9dc0a137b
Partially-Implements: blueprint network-commands-options
Closes-Bug: #1578819

subject: Improve test_delete_saving_image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-05 06:17:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/waiters.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_images.py'], 'message': 'Improve test_delete_saving_image

Currently, in test_delete_saving_image we will wait
until the image status changed to "Saving" state;
For testing using very small image(which will be a
common case for doing defcore tests) in an high
performance platorms, for example, the backend
for compute node and glance backend is the same
shared storage, the "saving" process could be
really fast, and the current minimal
client.build_interval is limited to 1s and this
may not be quickly enough to see the "saving"
status, and thus the test will fail.

We should also accept ACTIVE in this test to
make it pass if the above mentioned case happened.

Change-Id: I1f5f58d6d31fd0d1ca05b2de5ca8e72e1ac2a218
Closes-Bug: #1620185
'}]
commit_message:
Improve test_delete_saving_image

Currently, in test_delete_saving_image we will wait
until the image status changed to "Saving" state;
For testing using very small image(which will be a
common case for doing defcore tests) in an high
performance platorms, for example, the backend
for compute node and glance backend is the same
shared storage, the "saving" process could be
really fast, and the current minimal
client.build_interval is limited to 1s and this
may not be quickly enough to see the "saving"
status, and thus the test will fail.

We should also accept ACTIVE in this test to
make it pass if the above mentioned case happened.

Change-Id: I1f5f58d6d31fd0d1ca05b2de5ca8e72e1ac2a218
Closes-Bug: #1620185

to do the check, the test could be better and more easier
to understand if we use actual attachment number instead of
hardcoded value.

commit_message:
Enhancing Retry logic to Coordination when joining partitioning grp

Since currently it is in infinite loop it burns cpu cycles
continuosly when trying to join partitioning group and also keeps
filling logs leading to use up of entire disk/log partition.
This happens if zookeeper is in badshape and ceilometer component
using zookeeper for coordination

DocImpact: Adds new option parameters for ceilometer coordination
Change-Id: Icf60381e30f3baf986cf9e008e133287765d9827
Closes-Bug: #1558735

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-09 19:26:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/objects/base.py'], 'message': "Have a default OPTIONAL_FIELDS for persistent OVOs

Conditional update method from the persistent OVO class is blindly
relying on persistent OVOs having an OPTIONAl_FIELDS attribute without
defining a default.

This patch adds an empty default so we can do conditional updates on
persistent OVO instances that don't have optional fields.

Change-Id: Icf640da34df0990b5ad2609d5d230ac9b0a51311
"}]
commit_message:
Have a default OPTIONAL_FIELDS for persistent OVOs

Conditional update method from the persistent OVO class is blindly
relying on persistent OVOs having an OPTIONAl_FIELDS attribute without
defining a default.

This patch adds an empty default so we can do conditional updates on
persistent OVO instances that don't have optional fields.

Change-Id: Icf640da34df0990b5ad2609d5d230ac9b0a51311

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 14:15:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Fix creating typeless volumes with Mitaka's c-sch

In Mitaka as a workaround for creating volumes without volume type c-api
was sending an empty dictionary as request_spec['volume_type'] in
create_volume() RPC cast to scheduler. This changed in Newton and we're
handling this situation directly in scheduler, but when running Newton's
c-api with Mitaka's c-sch we should mimic older behavior. This patch
implements that.

Change-Id: I3dbb1934f3d8e68fef49f56155cbf59bc5fadc3a
Closes-Bug: 1619008
"}]
commit_message:
Fix creating typeless volumes with Mitaka's c-sch

In Mitaka as a workaround for creating volumes without volume type c-api
was sending an empty dictionary as request_spec['volume_type'] in
create_volume() RPC cast to scheduler. This changed in Newton and we're
handling this situation directly in scheduler, but when running Newton's
c-api with Mitaka's c-sch we should mimic older behavior. This patch
implements that.

Change-Id: I3dbb1934f3d8e68fef49f56155cbf59bc5fadc3a
Closes-Bug: 1619008

commit_message:
python-heatclient-1.5.0

This contains fixes and changes required by Newton tripleo,
specifically:
- Fix for bug #1619415 so that the event log has enough context for
  the user to know what is happening
- Support for parameter_merge_startegies section, which tripleo newton
  tripleo-heat-templates depends on

subject: Make Javascript implementation configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-21 13:08:01.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/utils/javascript.py', 'mistral/config.py'], 'message': 'Make Javascript implementation configurable

Currently the only Javascript implentation supported by the
std.javascript action is PyV8, a project that has been abandoned
for about two years and can only be compiled with an outdated
version of V8, one affected by several security vulnerabilities.

This change adds support for v8eval, a more recent interface to V8
that is still being maintained.

Change-Id: Id9cb89ffb05b37ef525a6085d49229de63420bbf
'}]
commit_message:
Make Javascript implementation configurable

Currently the only Javascript implentation supported by the
std.javascript action is PyV8, a project that has been abandoned
for about two years and can only be compiled with an outdated
version of V8, one affected by several security vulnerabilities.

This change adds support for v8eval, a more recent interface to V8
that is still being maintained.

Change-Id: Id9cb89ffb05b37ef525a6085d49229de63420bbf

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 17:20:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/numa_topology_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/fakes.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_numa_topology_filters.py'], 'message': 'Fix require thread policy for multi-NUMA computes

CPU thread policy "require" demands that instances are created on hosts
with hardware threads, e.g HyperThreading. It is possible that a compute
has several NUMA nodes, but only some of them contribute to the list of
pinned CPUs. In this case NUMATopologyFiler will exclude the compute
from candidates even if hardware threads are enabled and cores from
other NUMA nodes are available for CPU pinning.

This commit allows a compute with enabled HyperThreading to pass
NUMATopologyFilter if at least one NUMA node contributes to the list of
cores allowed for CPU pinning.

Change-Id: I3235cc6bf1a2a9e29a17acc43472e2a6bd4c26ec
Closes-Bug: 1596692
'}]
commit_message:
Fix require thread policy for multi-NUMA computes

CPU thread policy "require" demands that instances are created on hosts
with hardware threads, e.g HyperThreading. It is possible that a compute
has several NUMA nodes, but only some of them contribute to the list of
pinned CPUs. In this case NUMATopologyFiler will exclude the compute
from candidates even if hardware threads are enabled and cores from
other NUMA nodes are available for CPU pinning.

This commit allows a compute with enabled HyperThreading to pass
NUMATopologyFilter if at least one NUMA node contributes to the list of
cores allowed for CPU pinning.

Change-Id: I3235cc6bf1a2a9e29a17acc43472e2a6bd4c26ec
Closes-Bug: 1596692

While we wait on a solution to getting 802.1q access inside

commit_message:
Add basic status transition trunk scenario test

While we wait on a solution to getting 802.1q access inside
of the guest VM, it is helpful to at least have a test that
causes the agents to wire up trunk ports and ensure data model
status transitions happen as expected and that connectivity to
the trunk port itself is not disrupted by subport operations.

This test performs those assertions by booting two VMs with
trunk ports, creating subports on one, asserting statuses,
moving the subports to the other, and asserting statuses again
while ensuring connectivity to the VM in between.

This test uncovered both of the related bugs.

Related-Bug: #1625136
Related-Bug: #1625135
Change-Id: I5f634e3bcc54f5420ba49027b4fb250a13fe277a
(cherry picked from commit 88424604016416264804cd8d87c2cebc158c6157)

commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 11

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes the one warning from:

    unit.virt.libvirt.test_imagecache.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I057852125249d41d0b645a68013fef62249a2af7
Related-Bug: #1568414

subject: Return the result of create_plan in create_deployment_plan workflow
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-22 08:18:52.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/plan_management.yaml'], 'message': "Return the result of create_plan in create_deployment_plan workflow

This was a regression in Iff88d1a74cf608885eed92077f85accabf1e672e
which changed the result of the workflow from task(create_plan).result to
task(process_templates).result.

The return value of a workflow should not return a totally different result
because we have added a new task at the end, this is part of our interface and
shouldn't be changed without consideration.

Closes-Bug: #1625478
Change-Id: Ib351af78df7dff35c1a44b4d0329c684358908fa
"}]
commit_message:
Return the result of create_plan in create_deployment_plan workflow

This was a regression in Iff88d1a74cf608885eed92077f85accabf1e672e
which changed the result of the workflow from task(create_plan).result to
task(process_templates).result.

The return value of a workflow should not return a totally different result
because we have added a new task at the end, this is part of our interface and
shouldn't be changed without consideration.

Closes-Bug: #1625478
Change-Id: Ib351af78df7dff35c1a44b4d0329c684358908fa

commit_message:
Evaluate /etc/environment during repo building

This change causes the contents of /etc/environment to be
evaluated so that deployments in environments with HTTP
proxies can be successful.

Change-Id: Ida2a0465bea8b87bcb7a71c61661852ac1417391
Closes-Bug: 1625405
(cherry picked from commit 2988bee14a7ebcc7723f61b40a75dfad2d26b1f3)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-09 19:26:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/objects/volume_type.py'], 'message': 'Include OPTIONAL_FIELDS in VolumeType OVO class

Current code has OPTIONAL_FIELDS as part of the VolumeType library
instead of as a class attribute of the VolumeType OVO class.  This is
not how it should be, as there are methods -like conditional update-
that rely on the OPTIONAL_FIELDS being there.

This patch moves the OPTIONAL_FIELDS inside the VolumeType class.

Change-Id: I18404a2f32abc6c9d9b7d932a7acd299c4e708e5
'}]
commit_message:
Include OPTIONAL_FIELDS in VolumeType OVO class

Current code has OPTIONAL_FIELDS as part of the VolumeType library
instead of as a class attribute of the VolumeType OVO class.  This is
not how it should be, as there are methods -like conditional update-
that rely on the OPTIONAL_FIELDS being there.

This patch moves the OPTIONAL_FIELDS inside the VolumeType class.

Change-Id: I18404a2f32abc6c9d9b7d932a7acd299c4e708e5

subject: Change tooz and hbase requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-20 14:21:18.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Change tooz and hbase requirement

This change are merged together to fix the gating

hbase part:
The lib API have changed since 1.0 release, Aodh uses API
that have been removed/renamed.

So we cap requirement to <1.0 to ensure Aodh does not
break.

tooz part:
During the backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326573/, we bump
to 1.28. This version is too high for liberty.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/310337/ explains that only 1.19.0 is
required, that's perfect this is the version required by liberty.

Change-Id: I9b50ea959d8765ed0a53e0994f60774284a982cd
"}]
commit_message:
Change tooz and hbase requirement

This change are merged together to fix the gating

hbase part:
The lib API have changed since 1.0 release, Aodh uses API
that have been removed/renamed.

So we cap requirement to <1.0 to ensure Aodh does not
break.

tooz part:
During the backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326573/, we bump
to 1.28. This version is too high for liberty.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/310337/ explains that only 1.19.0 is
required, that's perfect this is the version required by liberty.

Change-Id: I9b50ea959d8765ed0a53e0994f60774284a982cd

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-07-05 11:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/base_filter.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_base_filter.py'], 'message': 'Add logging when filtering returns nothing

When hosts are filtered for a request, and no host passes all the
filters, operators can only see the last filter run; they have no
visibility into which filter removed which host. This attempts to
improve this situation by tracking the hosts remaining after each
filter is run and the number of hosts removed. If no host is left,
that information along with volume ID of the request would be logged.

Since that can be a lot of information, it will call LOG.info with
just the counts for all but the final filter, which will contain
the last deleted host names, LOG.debug will output the full record
of each filter and the hosts remaining after each step.

This will better enable operators to determine why a particular host
was not selected.

Change-Id: I3baf75a4a4430c55b30dde1cae86fa5e195ec6d3
'}]
commit_message:
Add logging when filtering returns nothing

When hosts are filtered for a request, and no host passes all the
filters, operators can only see the last filter run; they have no
visibility into which filter removed which host. This attempts to
improve this situation by tracking the hosts remaining after each
filter is run and the number of hosts removed. If no host is left,
that information along with volume ID of the request would be logged.

Since that can be a lot of information, it will call LOG.info with
just the counts for all but the final filter, which will contain
the last deleted host names, LOG.debug will output the full record
of each filter and the hosts remaining after each step.

This will better enable operators to determine why a particular host
was not selected.

Change-Id: I3baf75a4a4430c55b30dde1cae86fa5e195ec6d3

subject: Shell: restore & plan CLI parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-15 13:44:08.000000000', 'files': ['karborclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Shell: restore & plan CLI parameters

Current restore and plan parameter are passed in the key=value form,
which doesn't fix the requirement of key=value pairs for each
resource (i.e dictionary).
Change the restore and plan parameters to be passed in one of the
following formats:
1. JSON using the --parameter-json '{"OS::Cinder::Volume": { ... } }'
2. Multiple --parameter option for each resource:
   --parameter resource_type=OS::Cinder::Volume,resource_id=<uuid>,k=v

Change-Id: I416dc1f00060a5c994984ddfc04c30d1a04c803c
'}]
commit_message:
Shell: restore & plan CLI parameters

Current restore and plan parameter are passed in the key=value form,
which doesn't fix the requirement of key=value pairs for each
resource (i.e dictionary).
Change the restore and plan parameters to be passed in one of the
following formats:
1. JSON using the --parameter-json '{"OS::Cinder::Volume": { ... } }'
2. Multiple --parameter option for each resource:
   --parameter resource_type=OS::Cinder::Volume,resource_id=<uuid>,k=v

Change-Id: I416dc1f00060a5c994984ddfc04c30d1a04c803c

Protect now and restore success messages said the operations were
successful, although operation is async and only initiated.
Reflect the async message of these operations by using 'initiated'
terminology.

Change-Id: I8b15e0a58282dd18f2cbe65cacc1c64616212ff6
"}]
commit_message:
Protect, restore success message reflect async

Protect now and restore success messages said the operations were
successful, although operation is async and only initiated.
Reflect the async message of these operations by using 'initiated'
terminology.

Change-Id: I8b15e0a58282dd18f2cbe65cacc1c64616212ff6

commit_message:
Add settings to general config

Rather than setting undercloud_generate_service_certificate
in the release config, this review adds the setting to the
general config to avoid drift the between what is tested
in internal CI and external CI.

subject: Provide more information when 'node provide' fails
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-19 09:37:31.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/workflows/test_baremetal.py'], 'message': "Provide more information when 'node provide' fails

Because 'provide' calls to other workflows, the error message that
surfaces back can be quite difficult to parse. This attempts to make
the message more readable.

Change-Id: Iae3f29e5da25177fdee45752410f92b064c874c3
Depends-On: I8da43e4ff76488fc5cdb7bd2efa0cf9c39e7bb5e
Closes-Bug: #1620949
"}]
commit_message:
Provide more information when 'node provide' fails

Because 'provide' calls to other workflows, the error message that
surfaces back can be quite difficult to parse. This attempts to make
the message more readable.

Change-Id: Iae3f29e5da25177fdee45752410f92b064c874c3
Depends-On: I8da43e4ff76488fc5cdb7bd2efa0cf9c39e7bb5e
Closes-Bug: #1620949

commit_message:
Add new audit fields in dashboard tables

Due to bp persistent-audit-parameters, goal and strategy params
are now stored into audit object. So we have to update the way
to display them in horizon Optimization dashboard.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-21 08:02:17.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_object_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh'], 'message': 'Make sure major upgrade script fails.

Running upgrade-non-controller.sh against compute and object storage did
not fail if the /root/tripleo_upgrade_node.sh failed.

Closes-Bug: 1620973
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure major upgrade script fails.

Running upgrade-non-controller.sh against compute and object storage did
not fail if the /root/tripleo_upgrade_node.sh failed.

This make it harder to detect error in CI system for instance.

Change-Id: I12b7d640547d3b8ec1f70104d159d6052b7638ff
Closes-Bug: 1620973

commit_message:
[common] glossary: Update project ID entry

In most OpenStack deployment, project ID is assigned by keystone
and consumed by other OpenStack services.
The previous description was correct when OpenStack started
but it is no longer appropriate.

Change-Id: I41c28ea587814e8adae29f1f5cc0735fe1757411

subject: aodh: Don't run tempest on liberty
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-22 09:07:17.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "aodh: Don't run tempest on liberty

A recent change a43944cc83eac8153f7c6bd86b5f9b0b00b23937 have
make tempest run on liberty when liberty doesn't have tempest tests.

For example, we can see that gate-aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-mongodb run
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/373363/ when it should not.

This change fixes that

Change-Id: Ife55effbcc7741ef2c42c3a82e9c97be74718b53
"}]
commit_message:
aodh: Don't run tempest on liberty

A recent change a43944cc83eac8153f7c6bd86b5f9b0b00b23937 have
make tempest run on liberty when liberty doesn't have tempest tests.

For example, we can see that gate-aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-mongodb run
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/373363/ when it should not.

This change fixes that

Change-Id: Ife55effbcc7741ef2c42c3a82e9c97be74718b53

subject: Fix permission for /var/log/kolla folder
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-22 01:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ceph/ceph-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Fix permission for /var/log/kolla folder

Docker will change the name volume folder permission to image already
set. /var/log/kolla is not created and well configured in image.

This patch set creates and configures proper permission /var/log/kolla
in base image.
This patch set also fixed the ceph image by adding ceph user to kolla
group.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib5ef0187e90de2699b3cda31e819b4babb07e0af
'}]
commit_message:
Fix permission for /var/log/kolla folder

Docker will change the name volume folder permission to image already
set. /var/log/kolla is not created and well configured in image.

This patch set creates and configures proper permission /var/log/kolla
in base image.
This patch set also fixed the ceph image by adding ceph user to kolla
group.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib5ef0187e90de2699b3cda31e819b4babb07e0af

subject: Don't use cast() to do StackResource delete
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-22 00:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_nested_stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py'], 'message': "Don't use cast() to do StackResource delete

If an exception was raised in delete_stack when deleting a nested stack,
the parent stack would never hear about it because we were accidentally
using cast() instead of call() to do the stack delete. This meant the
parent resource would remain DELETE_IN_PROGRESS until timeout when the
nested stack had already failed and raised an exception.

In the case of bug 1499669, the exception being missed was
StopActionFailed.

Change-Id: I039eb8f6c6a262653c1e9edc8173e5680d81e31b
Partial-Bug: #1499669
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use cast() to do StackResource delete

If an exception was raised in delete_stack when deleting a nested stack,
the parent stack would never hear about it because we were accidentally
using cast() instead of call() to do the stack delete. This meant the
parent resource would remain DELETE_IN_PROGRESS until timeout when the
nested stack had already failed and raised an exception.

In the case of bug 1499669, the exception being missed was
StopActionFailed.

Change-Id: I039eb8f6c6a262653c1e9edc8173e5680d81e31b
Partial-Bug: #1499669

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-20 08:44:19.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_graph_extension.py'], 'message': 'Insert raw line after the title in custom graph tests

Our testrail reporter awaiting for raw line after docstring title;

commit_message:
Insert raw line after the title in custom graph tests

Our testrail reporter awaiting for raw line after docstring title;
without it reporter will try to use whole docstring as test name
and testrail will throw 400 error.

Change-Id: Ibd397e0dafadd2af6fd98b6b081887b6f27543c4

commit_message:
Bump tenacity to 3.1.0

tenacity 3.1.0 was recently released [1] and contains a
change we need for our effort of replacing retrying
with tenacity [2].

Note that this effort it not newton sensitive and therefore
can wait for ocata if needed.

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/tenacity/3.1.0
[2] http://goo.gl/6qpx8b

Change-Id: I0abb4cd390f2a0c27e97f7273538eb5da9cad397

subject: Fix helpers.common.rebalance_swift_ring method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-22 07:52:13.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/helpers/common.py'], 'message': 'Fix helpers.common.rebalance_swift_ring method

After recent refactoring of SSH manager executing
a command on a remote by default raises exception in
case the command exit code is any other than 0.
This effected in sporadical fails of
helpers.common.rebalance_swift_ring method, where
rebalance used to be done several times in some tests
and due to abovementioned change started to fail after
the very first unsuccessful attempt.

Change-Id: Ifbc832b1dad53b33ca223d3500306c386bab0d91
Closes-Bug: #1604271
'}]
commit_message:
Fix helpers.common.rebalance_swift_ring method

After recent refactoring of SSH manager executing
a command on a remote by default raises exception in
case the command exit code is any other than 0.
This effected in sporadical fails of
helpers.common.rebalance_swift_ring method, where
rebalance used to be done several times in some tests
and due to abovementioned change started to fail after
the very first unsuccessful attempt.

Change-Id: Ifbc832b1dad53b33ca223d3500306c386bab0d91
Closes-Bug: #1604271

subject: Only enabled services log files
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-18 11:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/common/templates/cron.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/tasks/config.yml'], 'message': 'Only enabled services log files

Only enabled services logs should be added to cron container
and be inclued in cron.json.
This PS adds logic to only copy enabled services cron files.

commit_message:
Only enabled services log files

Only enabled services logs should be added to cron container
and be inclued in cron.json.
This PS adds logic to only copy enabled services cron files.

Change-Id: Id6303a4c77a0230599e11be165489ba46dba65e0
Closes-bug: #1623712

By having serial in site.yml for these roles will mean (particularly

Closes-Bug: #1626096

commit_message:
Remove ansible serial: option for haproxy and rabbitmq.

By having serial in site.yml for these roles will mean (particularly
during an upgrade) that tasks can be executed out of the intended
order across hosts, leading to unexpected results.

Change-Id: I44f0c66c445d853a2e4af69119562f13b4424936
Closes-Bug: #1626096

Seems like zookeeper-shell.sh does not longer accept

However kafka >= 0.9.0.0 comes with new kafka-consumer-groups.sh

commit_message:
kafka_consumer for kafka >= 0.9.0.0

Detecting consumers with zookeeper-shell.sh
for kafka < 0.9.0.0 may not always work correctly.
Seems like zookeeper-shell.sh does not longer accept
batch command and work only in interactive mode.

However kafka >= 0.9.0.0 comes with new kafka-consumer-groups.sh
script that allows to detect consumers and associated topics.

Change-Id: Ifd2038c3ee36781f9d99c96b39557be4aab89209

subject: Convert =0 version specs to ==0 specs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 20:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/spec-semver-library-436b0db35fbd4c37.yaml', 'murano/dsl/helpers.py'], 'message': "Convert =0 version specs to ==0 specs

Murano is using semantic_version library for version specs. 2.3.1
version of the library, which is the minimum allowed for newton does not
treat '=0' as a valid spec, and requires '==0' (double equal signs).
This issue went unnoticed, since there 2.5.0 version of the library
allow both version spec, and it has been only discovered when, when
tested against packaged version of the library.
This commit converts any specs in format =\d.*
into ==.d.* format, thus adding compatibility to 2.3.1 library.

Closes-Bug: #1626238
Change-Id: I68b50726a8b6547cc768452dcfc197e072a8e104
"}]
commit_message:
Convert =0 version specs to ==0 specs

Murano is using semantic_version library for version specs. 2.3.1
version of the library, which is the minimum allowed for newton does not
treat '=0' as a valid spec, and requires '==0' (double equal signs).
This issue went unnoticed, since there 2.5.0 version of the library
allow both version spec, and it has been only discovered when, when
tested against packaged version of the library.
This commit converts any specs in format =\d.*
into ==.d.* format, thus adding compatibility to 2.3.1 library.

Closes-Bug: #1626238
Change-Id: I68b50726a8b6547cc768452dcfc197e072a8e104

commit_message:
Stop oslo_messaging from error logging CallbackNotFound

This is expected when the server is pushing for a resource
and some listeners (like the OVS agent) are not interested
in the event. This happens when Trunk create/delete events
are dispatched by the server.

Change-Id: I90ddffda546af45ca85b3e4f4f22eed005d971df
Closes-bug: #1625872
(cherry picked from commit bad3eaace1a320e33d3bcdff43e4c66ff0c49066)

After recent refactoring of SSH manager executing

This effected in sporadical fails of
helpers.common.rebalance_swift_ring method, where
rebalance used to be done several times in some tests

commit_message:
Fix helpers.common.rebalance_swift_ring method

After recent refactoring of SSH manager executing
a command on a remote by default raises exception in
case the command exit code is any other than 0.
This effected in sporadical fails of
helpers.common.rebalance_swift_ring method, where
rebalance used to be done several times in some tests
and due to abovementioned change started to fail after
the very first unsuccessful attempt.

Change-Id: Ifbc832b1dad53b33ca223d3500306c386bab0d91
Closes-Bug: #1604271

commit_message:
telemetry: fix liberty gate

We recently default CEILOMETER_BACKEND to Gnocchi for the integration
testing, but that was not supported for liberty branches.

The Gnocchi was enabled in additional to the legacy Ceilometer storage
not as replacement like we do now.

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I7863debdc80126c44c49c7abd8e62a47cdaf559b

commit_message:
Add network segment create, delete and set support

Add network segment create, delete and set in support of routed
networks. This patch set includes documentation, unit tests and
functional tests for the following new commands:
  - "os network segment create"
  - "os network segment delete"
  - "os network segment set"
This patch set also includes support for the name and description
properties.

These new commands are currently marked as beta commands.

Change-Id: I86bc223c4adc5b5fe1b1ee5c9253e43ba52fb5ed
Depends-On: Ib194125162057fccb4e951587c2fa4ec2e2f098c
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Garbage collect HasStandardAttributes subclasses in StandardAttrTestCase

get_standard_attr_resource_model_map on next plugin instantiation.

(cherry picked from commit 414f607374e7d5ee7048539aa2aa96fae040d6cb)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-20 23:24:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py'], 'message': 'Fetch insert UUID in ovsdb idl transaction

For insertion commands submitted in ovsdb idl transaction, they may return
the inserted rows uuids. But from the ovs.db.idl.Row side, we will
get a provisional UUID [1], not the UUID assigned by ovsdb-server, any
operation like adding this UUID as reference to another row column, will
fail.
This patch uses ovs.db.idl.Transaction method get_insert_uuid [2] to try to
get final UUID a inserted row assigned, if a command returns a UUID.

[1]:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L1484-L1500
[2]:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L1426-L1443

Change-Id: I7d8cd7c594d2403d15614849c69d4558f83d3b0e
'}]
commit_message:
Fetch insert UUID in ovsdb idl transaction

For insertion commands submitted in ovsdb idl transaction, they may return
the inserted rows uuids. But from the ovs.db.idl.Row side, we will
get a provisional UUID [1], not the UUID assigned by ovsdb-server, any
operation like adding this UUID as reference to another row column, will
fail.
This patch uses ovs.db.idl.Transaction method get_insert_uuid [2] to try to
get final UUID a inserted row assigned, if a command returns a UUID.

[1]:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L1484-L1500
[2]:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L1426-L1443

Change-Id: I7d8cd7c594d2403d15614849c69d4558f83d3b0e

commit_message:
Retrieve zaqar websocket url from keystone

Instead of hardcoding a value, let's try and retrieve it from keystone.
This will ensure that we're using the correct url in an SSL-enabled
scenario.

Furthermore, this brings the zaqar API service to a consistent state
with the other services.

Change-Id: I70f0056688b8f3a6fa2e5bb508b13c9af953b489
Closes-bug: #1621639

commit_message:
Remove ACLs to push signed tags from neutron-release

All neutron stadium releases are now handled through openstack/releases
repo, so there is no need for the group to be able to release by other
means.

commit_message:
Backport "Check for _interfaces in updated_router"

When a router update without an '_interfaces' element is received by the
FWaaS v2 L3 agent extension, the extension does not handle it
gracefully.  This adds a check for that field.

This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/371611 to 
stable/newton.

Change-Id: I545ae19434e9d62492191eef007b70f29ff3f971
Closes-Bug: #1625818

subject: Use ovs.db.idl to monitor ovsdb
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-21 10:52:44.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/db/drivers/ovsdb_vswitch_impl.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_ovsdb_monitor.py', 'dragonflow/controller/df_local_controller.py'], 'message': 'Use ovs.db.idl to monitor ovsdb

When the ovs idl client connects to the ovsdb-server, it gets a dump
of all DB resources. DF can just use the idl to monitor ovsdb. This
could simplify the code, and save the procedure to explicitly notify
ovs interface creation.

Change-Id: I08be04d90f709e54ffb91f2fff4dc3efba9506ed
Partial-Bug: #1622879
'}]
commit_message:
Use ovs.db.idl to monitor ovsdb

When the ovs idl client connects to the ovsdb-server, it gets a dump
of all DB resources. DF can just use the idl to monitor ovsdb. This
could simplify the code, and save the procedure to explicitly notify
ovs interface creation.

Change-Id: I08be04d90f709e54ffb91f2fff4dc3efba9506ed
Partial-Bug: #1622879

subject: Clean-up Tempest test networks with project_id
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6524, 'name': 'Henry Gessau', 'email': 'HenryG@gessau.net', 'username': 'gessau'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-21 22:01:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/admin/test_networks.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_networks.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Clean-up Tempest test networks with project_id

Recently, Tempest test cases were added to test the creation
of networks with project_id. These test cases call the Tempest
network client directly. As a consequence, the test networks
are not cleaned-up after test execution.

This patchset adds a utility method to handle the creation of
networks with project_id that sets them up for deletion at the
end of the test

Change-Id: Id0caec5529f1b37a2abe22488b2f64f75fb56736
'}]
commit_message:
Clean-up Tempest test networks with project_id

Recently, Tempest test cases were added to test the creation
of networks with project_id. These test cases call the Tempest
network client directly. As a consequence, the test networks
are not cleaned-up after test execution.

This patchset adds a utility method to handle the creation of
networks with project_id that sets them up for deletion at the
end of the test

Change-Id: Id0caec5529f1b37a2abe22488b2f64f75fb56736

subject: Convert =0 version specs to ==0 specs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 20:29:10.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/spec-semver-library-436b0db35fbd4c37.yaml', 'murano/dsl/helpers.py'], 'message': "Convert =0 version specs to ==0 specs

Murano is using semantic_version library for version specs. 2.3.1
version of the library, which is the minimum allowed for newton does not
treat '=0' as a valid spec, and requires '==0' (double equal signs).
This issue went unnoticed, since there 2.5.0 version of the library
allow both version spec, and it has been only discovered when, when
tested against packaged version of the library.
This commit converts any specs in format =\d.*
into ==.d.* format, thus adding compatibility to 2.3.1 library.

Closes-Bug: #1626238
Change-Id: I68b50726a8b6547cc768452dcfc197e072a8e104
"}]
commit_message:
Convert =0 version specs to ==0 specs

Murano is using semantic_version library for version specs. 2.3.1
version of the library, which is the minimum allowed for newton does not
treat '=0' as a valid spec, and requires '==0' (double equal signs).
This issue went unnoticed, since there 2.5.0 version of the library
allow both version spec, and it has been only discovered when, when
tested against packaged version of the library.
This commit converts any specs in format =\d.*
into ==.d.* format, thus adding compatibility to 2.3.1 library.

Closes-Bug: #1626238
Change-Id: I68b50726a8b6547cc768452dcfc197e072a8e104

subject: Add to rally quotas to handle worst case quota race
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6524, 'name': 'Henry Gessau', 'email': 'HenryG@gessau.net', 'username': 'gessau'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-22 00:23:27.000000000', 'files': ['rally-jobs/neutron-neutron.yaml'], 'message': 'Add to rally quotas to handle worst case quota race

Quoting the quota devref:
"""
For a reservation to be successful, the total amount of resources requested,
plus the total amount of resources reserved, plus the total amount of resources
already stored in the database should not exceed the project's quota limit.
"""

This means that in the absolute worst case scenario with 20 concurrent
workers, 19 could have made reservations, committed resources, but not
yet cleared their reservation. Because of the outstanding reservation
and the resources created by the 19 workers, they will all be
double-counted until their reservation is cleared (or it expires).

This adjusts the rally scenarios to handle the double-count for
concurrency.

Related-Bug: #1623390
Change-Id: I4808a92e7e6067aeeb62fc3b3d7f7ac71b179c44
'}]
commit_message:
Add to rally quotas to handle worst case quota race

Quoting the quota devref:
"""
For a reservation to be successful, the total amount of resources requested,
plus the total amount of resources reserved, plus the total amount of resources
already stored in the database should not exceed the project's quota limit.
"""

This means that in the absolute worst case scenario with 20 concurrent
workers, 19 could have made reservations, committed resources, but not
yet cleared their reservation. Because of the outstanding reservation
and the resources created by the 19 workers, they will all be
double-counted until their reservation is cleared (or it expires).

This adjusts the rally scenarios to handle the double-count for
concurrency.

Related-Bug: #1623390
Change-Id: I4808a92e7e6067aeeb62fc3b3d7f7ac71b179c44

commit_message:
Make port_binding_extension mandatory if host_id is specified

In case create_port is called with host_id it's better to fail if
port_binding_extension is not available. Otherwise there won't
be any binding and no logging that the port will be inactive.

Change-Id: I65595308bc71ae78c992fd97e3f26fd718b249ec
Closes-bug: #1602525

subject: Support floating ip deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-22 01:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/xjob/xmanager.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_plugin.py', 'tricircle/network/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Support floating ip deletion

1. What is the problem
User cannot correctly delete floating ip via the Tricirce plugin.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Overwrite delete_floatingip method in the Tricircle plugin. We
first update the floating ip to disassociate it with fixed ip,
then invoke delete_floatingip method in the base class to delete
the database record.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
Deletion of floating ip is now supported.

Change-Id: Ia8bf6e7499321c1be085533e8695eea6ac8ef26d
'}]
commit_message:
Support floating ip deletion

1. What is the problem
User cannot correctly delete floating ip via the Tricirce plugin.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Overwrite delete_floatingip method in the Tricircle plugin. We
first update the floating ip to disassociate it with fixed ip,
then invoke delete_floatingip method in the base class to delete
the database record.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
Deletion of floating ip is now supported.

Change-Id: Ia8bf6e7499321c1be085533e8695eea6ac8ef26d

commit_message:
Fix pylint error:_find_users

I found a simple way to avoid _find_user mistake, before we can
call list_access (list_access just be used in drop_user) ,let
drop_user invokes the _find_user, then pass the result returned
to list_access.

Closes-Bug: #1624999
Change-Id: I7279c68f86427d8719ce22332462a57d4d67fa1f

This is expected when the server is pushing for a resource
and some listeners (like the OVS agent) are not interested
in the event. This happens when Trunk create/delete events
are dispatched by the server.

commit_message:
Stop oslo_messaging from error logging CallbackNotFound

This is expected when the server is pushing for a resource
and some listeners (like the OVS agent) are not interested
in the event. This happens when Trunk create/delete events
are dispatched by the server.

Change-Id: I90ddffda546af45ca85b3e4f4f22eed005d971df
Closes-bug: #1625872
